title: Chelsea 1-2 Man Utd: 5 talking points as Marcus Rashford fires Red Devils to win
text:

Marcus Rashford scored a 35-yard free-kick that Cristiano Ronaldo would have been proud of to fire Manchester United into the Carabao Cup fifth round.

The United and England striker bagged the reds’ first goal with a 24th-minute penalty after Marcos Alonso brought down Daniel James.

And after Michy Batshuayi had drawn Chelsea level with a fine and deserved equaliser on the hour-mark, Rashford then wrapped his right boot around a sumptuous set-piece that left Willy Caballero no chance.

Ole Gunnar Solskjaer’s men have proved a thorn in Blues boss Frank Lampard’s side this season.

They beat them 4-0 on the opening day of the season, a result which didn’t reflect the closeness of the game.

Chelsea had much more possession than the visitors here at Stamford Bridge but Rashford’s seventh and eighth goals of the season saw his side to victory again.

(Image: Action Images via Reuters)

(Image: Getty Images)

Batshuayi stakes a claim

Michy Batshuayi sent Chelsea boss Frank Lampard and his Belgium manager Roberto Martinez another reminder that he can do the business when given a chance with a cracking goal.

The self-styled ‘Batman’ headed Willy Caballero’s clearance over Harry Maguire on the halfway line, turned and advanced to the edge of the United box with the England defender on his tail.

There were four other red shirts around him as he travelled but none got close enough to stop him drilling a very good, low finish beyond Sergio Romero.

It was his eighth goal in 10 games for club and country this season yet he’s behind Tammy Abraham at Chelsea and Romelu Lukaku with Belgium.

The 26-year-old was told he could leave Stamford Bridge in the summer but loves life in London and fought to stay.

Lampard will be pleased he did.

(Image: EMPICS Sport)

Giroud out in the cold

A penny for or Olivier Giroud’s thoughts after the striker failed even to get a start in Frank Lampard’s Carabao Cup team.

The World Cup-winning Frenchman has found himself behind Tammy Abraham in the Premier League this season and will have viewed this clash with United as an ideal opportunity to get minutes into his legs.

Boss Frank Lampard has made it clear to Giroud that he wants him to stay at the club but the striker has started just one game this season and, at 33, he knows he can’t afford to spend too much time on the bench.

A move away from the club in January looks increasingly likely.

(Image: REUTERS)

Williams ready to rough it

Brandon Williams, Manchester United’s 19-year-old left-back, looks cherubic but a clash with Chelsea’s Callum Hudson-Odoi early in the second half suggested he might just be another baby-faced assassin.

The pair were tussling for the ball close to the touchline and the United kid, annoyed by Hudson-Odoi’s grappling, grabbed his opponent and rolled him into the advertising board.

Solskjaer will like the fact Williams will refuse to be bullied in senior football and, while Hudson-Odoi caught him out a couple of times, there were a couple of excellent blocks and tackles from the defender.

This game, his fifth appearance of the season, will have been another good step in his education.

(Image: Getty Images)

Jorginho handed armband

Granit Xhaka only need look to Chelsea midfielder Jorginho for proof that there is a way back after your own fans have turned on you.

The Brazil-born Italy international was a target for the Chelsea boo-boys last season because he was seen as Maurizio Sarri’s pet and the fans had had enough of the manager.

But he has rejuvenated his relationship thanks to his performances under Frank Lampard this season and is one of the most important players in the Chelsea squad.

The circumstances of Xhaka’s fallout with Arsenal supporters are different, of course, and he’s not as talented as Jorginho.

But if he can get his head down and work hard, as Jorginho has done, then long term there may be a future for the Swiss at the Emirates … if he still wants it.

(Image: PA)

Zouma steps up

Kurt Zouma bore the brunt of the blame after Manchester United’s 4-0 victory over Chelsea on the opening day of the season.

So he will have been much happier with the way things went at Stamford Bridge.

The Frenchman has found his performances, like so many of his team-mates, regularly overshadowed by his younger team-mates.

But he has been impressive overall since returning to the Bridge and has been a big help in Fikayo Tomori’s settling into the Chelsea defence.

Against United, Zouma had another academy product, Marc Guehi alongside him, and he was a big help to the youngster all evening.
description: Rashford scored once in each half to send Ole Gunnar Solskjaer's side into the Carabao Cup quarter-finals
